oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the mean production-rate analysis of a 2-stage production system with end buffer and random demand
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GOPALAN, MN
ANANTHARAMAN, N
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: probability
production system
queuing
stochastic modeling
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper deals with the transient fluctuations of the mean production rate of a two-stage production system subject to interstage and end inspections and end butter. The interstage and end inspections are instantaneous, and the end buffer is with finite capacity of size N. A stochastic model is developed to describe the system, and analytical expressions to evaluate the mean production rate (MPR) of machine j (= I, II) in [0, t] with arbitrary distributions of processing times at the stages of production and exponential supply and demand pattern have been obtained by using the state-space method and the regeneration-point technique. A particular case is investigated, and numerical results are presented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF THE OPERATIONAL RESEARCH SOCIETY,41(10)977-981
